item.content:encoded:
Digital business cards are the solution that enable you to leave behind traditional paper cards. If you’re not aware of what these are, we recommend you read our article ¿What are cards?, in which we explain everything you need to know to get started. In this article we’ll give you the reasons for why you need to take them with you to the next conventions you attend.

The main objective of conventions and exhibitions is to publicize your company or project and connect with people who may be interested in investing in it or buying your products or hiring your services. It is one of the scenarios in which contact cards and brochures are distributed the most, but many times they are not very effective, because they get lost or end up in the bin.

Ideally, you should be able to share your contact and relevant business information with interested visitors quickly, easily and effectively. This is possible with vcards by TicTAP. Just by showing a QR code on your mobile, the other person will scan it on theirs, and your contact information (name, email, and telephone number) and links to your website and to the vcard platform, will be transferred to their contact book. From there they will see catalogues, videos, and much more. You choose what content to upload!

With vcards you will gain more comfort  at conventions since you will be able to move around the stands without having to carry a mountain of paper to distribute. Wherever we go we always take our mobile phones with us so you can ensure that you’ll always have what you need to present with you your solution. You’ll also have saved time and money in printing the material, and most importantly, you will favor the environment!

item.content:encoded:
El término paperless se refiere a la disminución del uso del papel, medida comúnmente aplicada al espacio de trabajo o de estudios. Somos una empresa comprometida con el medio ambiente y en este artículo nos centraremos en algunos de los motivos por qué y cómo acercar tu oficina a ser paperless.

 

Motivos por los que digitalizar tu trabajo y dejar de usar papel

La razón principal por la cual deberías disminuir el consumo de papel es por el impacto perjudicial que ocasiona en el medio ambiente. La producción y distribución del papel supone la tala de árboles, el gasto de agua, el uso de productos químicos tóxicos y las emisiones emitidas por el transporte desde la fábrica a tu oficina. Después de su uso se suele convertir en un desecho que muchas veces no es correctamente reciclado.

Otra de los motivos por los cuales considerar bajar el consumo de papel es el ahorro económico que supone. No estarías gastando en comprar papel, tinta ni otros materiales, ni también en el espacio físico que a veces se requiere para almacenar la documentación o el coste de mantenimiento que muchas impresoras requieren.

Por último, la efectividad que aporta la transformación digital al mundo laboral es también una ventaja. Tener la documentación en un espacio virtual permite que se pueda trabajar en conjunto desde diferentes puntos geográficos y de una manera inmediata. También permite la sencilla integración entre aplicaciones.

 

 

Acciones recomendadas para conseguir ser paperless

El primer paso que debes tomar hacia la transformación digital es contratar servicios de almacenamiento en la nube. Seguramente ya lo estés haciendo en alguna medida, pero intenta que todos los proyectos y tareas que tu equipo lleven a cabo se hagan a través del espacio de trabajo virtual. También puedes tener un bloc de notas siempre abierto para ir apuntando tus ideas y utilizar aplicaciones que te ayuden a organizarte, sin tener que recurrir a la libreta tradicional.

El siguiente paso es digitalizar tu firma. Aunque la mayoría de empresas trabajan en su mayoría solo con el ordenador, siguen imprimiendo documentos que requieren firmas para después escanearlos y devolver el envío. Estos pasos te los puedes ahorrar y puedes agilizar el proceso contratando un servicio de digitalización de firmas.

El último paso que te recomendamos implementar y con el que te podemos ayudar es a deshacerte de las tarjetas de visita tradicionales, los folletos y los catálogos y pasarte a las vcards (si no sabes que son este artículo te explica todo lo que necesitas saber en un par de minutos: ¿Qué son las vcards?).

Con las tarjetas de contacto digitalizadas estarás reduciendo considerablemente el consumo de papel y estarás conectando de una manera más efectiva. Además, a través de las vcards by TicTAP podrás también compartir la misma información que repartirías en folletos o presentarías en catálogos, pero de una manera más práctica, dinámica, económica y sostenible.

 

¿Tu empresa está siguiendo una estrategia hacia la digitalización y sostenibilidad? ¿Qué más medidas recomendarías desde tu experiencia? Gracias por leer este artículo y te invitamos a que lo compartas y continúes leyendo otros de nuestro blog. Si tienes alguna duda o te interesaría información no dudes en contactarnos en vcards@tictap.me.

item.content:encoded:
The term engagement has been gaining a lot of relevance during recent years in most companies’ marketing strategies. This article explains what it implies, how it can help you grow your business, and some ways and tools to optimize it.

In marketing, engagement refers to the interactions we have with customers or social media users who may be potential customers. Interactions with your profile or posts may include: liking, leaving a comment, answering a survey, sharing it on their profile or sending it in a message to one of their friends, sending a direct message and saving the post to see it later. These are some of the most frequent ways of interacting and that give more results.

Having many followers doesn’t mean that an account is well positioned on social networks, as followers can be bought and because many of those users may have started following the account a long time ago and even if they’re no longer interested in it’s content, they’re not bothered because it’s not even shown on their homepage. This is because most algorithms give priority to displaying the content that the user interacts with the most, as they understand that this is the content that interests them the most.

Why is it important to maintain a good level of engagement on your social networks?

On first place, it will make your brand have more reach, because if the algorithm detects your content as interesting for some users, it will recommend it to others with similar tastes. On second place, because it’s a way to build customer loyalty. If you provide added value to users who know your brand and have already tried one of your products or services by creating content that helps them and entertains them, you’ll make them identify with your brand and become a benchmark in that sector for them, and they’ll come to you to repeat the transaction or try other of your products.

Now you may ask yourself, how can I get a good engagement with my community? As I mentioned before, you have to create quality content that your followers will enjoy. To do this you first need to know the needs and aspirations of your audience. Also keep in mind that to capture their attention it has to be digestible and somehow entertaining.

But many times, even if the user finds your publication interesting, he/she does not interact with it or perhaps only indicates that he/she likes it. To achieve an interaction in which the user responds or comments you can spread your content on other channels such as Discord or Telegram. Increasingly, influencers and brands are setting up groups on these platforms to promote engagement with their followers in a more active way. This especially works in cases where the social media profiles already have some presence and a built-up community. 

What can you do to get your customers and prospects to actively interact with the content you create for them if you are not established on a social network or perhaps your audience is not as active?

Vcards by TicTAP’s digital business cards are a solution to this problem. If you don’t know what vcards are, you can find out in less than 5 minutes by reading our article: What are vcards?

Through our vcards you can share much more than just your contact information as their functionalities go beyond those of a business card. You can send push notifications to encourage users who have your saved contact to interact with the new content you post on the vcard, filling out surveys of all kinds, sending questions on the spot, or browsing through the menu where they will find videos or presentations created by you for them. 

You’ll also be able to link and concentrate all your social media profiles in the vcard to make sure your community knows where to find you and grow your presence through this platform. Vcards by TicTAP are a very useful tool to keep a close communication with your potential and existing customers.

The post What are vcards? appeared first on Vcards by TicTAP.
item.content:encoded:
Vcards are the digital version of traditional business cards. They are a tool that’s turning upside down how we connect with companies and between people. 

They work in a simple way, by means of a QR code on your mobile you share your vcard with whoever you want to connect, for example, a prospect, an investor or a colleague. When the person scans the QR on their mobile, your information and the link to the card are automatically saved in their contact book. You can also share it through a link by direct messages or email or adding it in your social media profile.

Vcards are an ecological and economical solution to the waste of single use paper caused by traditional business cards. If you decide to make the change, you will be adopting a sustainable measure that will also save you money and with which you will ensure that your contact information is not lost or forgotten as it often happens with many paper business cards. Vcards are also dynamic as they allow you to change the data and have it updated instantly.

The market consists of a wide variety of brands that offer digital business cards, but vcards by TicTAP are the only 360 option, here’s why:

#offline They also work without signal or internet connection.

#noapp Neither you nor the other person need to download an app.

#content Share multimedia content such as photos, videos, presentations or brochures.

#traceable They can be integrated with CRMs, ERPs or Analytics to measure interactions.

#languages ​​The information will be displayed in the language of the user who scans it.

#multi-brand and #multi-branch Set up different vcards for each brand, line of business and branch.

#engagement Interact with users through forms and surveys.

#customizable We customize your vcards following the design of your brand.

#self-manageable You can manage them autonomously through our platform.
